chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (f : R -> R -> R) (p q r s : nat) (x y : R), q = 0%nat \/ r = 0%nat -> partial_derive p q (partial_derive r s f) x y = partial_derive (p + r) (q + s) f x y

Premises:
partial_derive = fun (m k : nat) (f : R -> R -> R) (x y : R) => Derive_n (fun t : R => Derive_n (fun z : R => f t z) k y) m x : nat -> nat -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope]

Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
partial_derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R -> R) (p q : nat) (x y : R), locally_2d (fun u v : R => f u v = g u v) x y -> partial_derive p q f x y = partial_derive p q g x y
differential = fun (p : nat) (f : R -> R -> R) (x y dx dy : R) => sum_f_R0 (fun m : nat => C p m * partial_derive m (p - m) f x y * dx ^ m * dy ^ (p - m)) p : nat -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> R -> R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [nat_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope R_scope R_scope]
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y

Zdiv.Zdiv_unique : forall a b q r : Z, (0 <= r < b)%Z -> a = (b * q + r)%Z -> q = (a / b)%Z
Nat.divmod_spec : forall x y q u : nat, (u <= y)%nat -> let (q', u') := Nat.divmod x y q u in (x + S y * q + (y - u))%nat = (S y * q' + (y - u'))%nat /\ (u' <= y)%nat
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0%nat -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = (q * r)%nat /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, (r < b)%nat -> a = (b * q + r)%nat -> q = (a / b)%nat
Derive_n = fix Derive_n (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => f x | S n0 => Derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope]
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0%nat -> x = (y * (x / y) + x mod y)%nat
Rabs = fun r : R => if Rcase_abs r then - r else r : R -> R Argument scope is [R_scope]

inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> Z.of_nat x = Z.of_nat y
Derive_n_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x

Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = (p * x)%nat) (exists p : nat, y = (p * x')%nat) (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = (p * x)%nat) (fun p : nat => y = (p * x')%nat) (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x)%nat (p * x')%nat (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = (p * x')%nat) (exists...
pow = fix pow (r : R) (n : nat) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => 1 | S n0 => r * pow r n0 end : R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope nat_scope]
Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p = Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0%nat => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0%nat => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
Rle_lt_0_plus_1 : forall r : R, 0 <= r -> 0 < r + 1
Pos2Nat.inj_compare : forall p q : positive, (p ?= q)%positive = (Pos.to_nat p ?= Pos.to_nat q)
locally_2d = fun (P : R -> R -> Prop) (x y : R) => exists delta : posreal, forall u v : R, Rabs (u - x) < delta -> Rabs (v - y) < delta -> P u v : (R -> R -> Prop) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Pos2Nat.inj_mul : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat (p * q) = (Pos.to_nat p * Pos.to_nat q)%nat
Pos2Nat.inj_sub_max : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat (p - q) = Nat.max 1 (Pos.to_nat p - Pos.to_nat q)
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Argument scopes are [positive_scope positive_scope]
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0%nat -> a = (b * q)%nat -> q = (a / b)%nat
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = (z * x)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
locally = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (P : T -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : T, ball x eps y -> P y : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
